item.title: European Super League: Ministers say they will work to block breakaway group
item.description: The PM says the government will work to make sure the competition does not go ahead as proposed.

item.title: European Super League: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp against idea but will not quit
item.description: Jurgen Klopp is determined to remain as Liverpool boss and "help sort it" after reiterating his opposition to the European Super League.

item.title: Government to speed up UK climate change target
item.description: Boris Johnson says carbon emissions must fall by 78% by 2035 - 15 years earlier than previously planned.

item.title: George Floyd: US city on edge as jury deliberates Chauvin verdict
item.description: Security is ramped up in Minneapolis as jurors retire in the trial into the death of George Floyd.

item.title: George Floyd death: Three Americans assess Derek Chauvin trial
item.description: A retired police veteran, a Minnesota resident and a black political hopeful share their thoughts.

item.title: 'Russia is heading for a catastrophe'
item.description: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg travels 2,000 miles east of Moscow to gauge the mood of ordinary Russians.

item.title: Former US Vice-President Walter Mondale dies aged 93
item.description: Jimmy Carter's running mate lost heavily to Ronald Reagan in the 1984 presidential election.

item.title: Covid-19: India added to coronavirus ‘red list’ for travel
item.description: It means most travel to the UK from India will be banned from 04:00 BST on Friday, amid Covid concerns.

item.title: Car insurance sees biggest price drop in six years
item.description: The average cost of car insurance has fallen by £87 in 12 months, according to new data.

item.title: Brian Sicknick: US Capitol riot policeman 'died of natural causes'
item.description: Officials say Brian Sicknick died after suffering two strokes, a day after being confronted by rioters.

item.title: Covid: Police watchdog says officers confused by unclear pandemic laws
item.description: A major review of policing during the pandemic says officers regularly struggled to enforce restrictions.

item.title: Sturgeon expected to confirm further lockdown easing
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon is likely to say that hospitality, gyms and non-essential shops will be able to open from Monday.

item.title: James Charles: YouTube temporarily demonetises beauty influencer
item.description: The YouTuber admitted to messaging with 16-year-old boys earlier this month.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Great game robbery' and 'red card from Wills'
item.description: Opposition and anger towards the European Super League plans dominate Tuesday morning's front pages.

item.title: Are black women getting enough support for mental health?
item.description: Black women are more likely than white women to experience common mental health problems.

item.title: How a bicycle tripled one woman's income
item.description: "You realise what a bicycle can do. It's a catalyst for unlocking so much potential."

item.title: Redonda: The Caribbean island transformed into an eco haven
item.description: After invasive rats and goats were removed from Redonda, the island's wildlife has been thriving.

item.title: Handcuffed, blindfolded and beaten on Libya's front line
item.description: Special correspondent Feras Kilani on what it's been like to cover the 10 years since Colonel Gaddafi was deposed and killed.

item.title: All the times the US spent big on infrastructure
item.description: Where does President Biden's plan rank among the largest projects in American history?

item.title: 'Do you know who the West of England mayor is?'
item.description: The PM was short of answers when asked about the Tory mayor while campaigning in Gloucestershire.

item.title: Australia New Zealand bubble: Emotional families reunite as quarantine-free travel begins
item.description: The first flight, from Sydney to Auckland, carried thrilled travellers to reunite with loved ones.

item.title: Star Wars: David Prowse's collection to be auctioned off
item.description: Items from actor David Prowse, who played villain Darth Vader, are up for sale.

item.title: Oscars 2021: 19 geeky facts from Borat to Boseman
item.description: Everything you need to know ahead of the 93rd Academy Awards on Sunday.

item.title: Super League: Why are football's biggest clubs starting a new tournament?
item.description: Europe's biggest teams have suffered during the Covid pandemic and say they want financial stability.

item.title: Could electric tattoos be the next step in body art?
item.description: Researchers are experimenting with thin, flexible circuits that can be transferred to the skin.

item.title: Online dating: 'In 2021 everyone is a kind-of catfish'
item.description: The hit US reality show is getting its own UK version - hosted by Julie Adenuga and Oobah Butler.

item.title: The Ugandan mum who was once ashamed of her gay son
item.description: A support group in Uganda is helping parents come to terms with their children's sexuality.

item.title: George Floyd death: Five key moments from the Derek Chauvin trial
item.description: As the jury deliberates a verdict, here are the key elements of a trial that has gripped the US.

item.title: The GRU: Blast puts spotlight on shadowy Russian force
item.description: The role of Russia's GRU agency in a fatal 2014 explosion raises questions about its capabilities.

item.title: Covid: Why was India not already on the red list?
item.description: Why is India being put on the travel ban list two weeks after Pakistan and Bangladesh?

item.title: Llorente denies Liverpool place in top four
item.description: Diego Llorente scores a late equaliser for Leeds to deny Liverpool a place in the top four of the Premier League - as uncertainty reigns over what that would mean.

item.title: World Cup and Euros ban threat for Super League players
item.description: Uefa president Aleksander Ceferin says the European Super League is a "disgraceful, self-serving" proposal.

item.title: World Snooker Championship: John Higgins, Anthony McGill and Kyren Wilson progress at Crucible
item.description: Four-time champion John Higgins wins six frames in a row to see off Tian Pengfei in the World Championship first round.

item.title: George Russell apologises for Valtteri Bottas crash in Emilia Romagna Grand Prix
item.description: Williams driver George Russell issues a public apology following his crash with Valtteri Bottas in the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix.

item.title: 'The players and I were not involved' - Klopp on Liverpool's European Super League entry
item.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says he and his players were not involved with the club's decision to join the European Super League.

item.title: European Super League: Gary Lineker on Liverpool, Man Utd, Chelsea, Man City, Arsenal & Spurs' plan
item.description: Gary Lineker says "it's a time of great concern" when asked about a new European Super League, adding that it could have "massive ramifications on our game".

item.title: Election 2021: How do I register to vote?
item.description: About 48 million people will be able to vote in a series of elections on Thursday, 6 May.

item.title: 2021 elections: What elections can I vote in this year?
item.description: National elections in Scotland and Wales and local elections in England are scheduled for 6 May 2021.

item.title: 2021 elections: A simple guide to the Scottish, Welsh and local elections
item.description: A bumper crop of elections are being held on 6 May across England, Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Scottish election 2021: The voters the parties are vying to win over
item.description: We speak to five voters who have yet to make up their minds in the Scottish election.

item.title: Election 2021: Why is turnout so low in one Hull ward?
item.description: People in a ward with one of the lowest election turnouts in England give their views on voting.

item.title: What are the Indian, Brazil, South Africa and UK variants?
item.description: Cases are being found in the UK and the changes the virus is undergoing are concerning.

item.title: When does the stamp duty holiday in England and Northern Ireland end?
item.description: What is the stamp duty holiday and when will it finish?

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Which countries are on the red list and what are the quarantine rules?
item.description: Many travellers are no longer allowed to enter the UK from countries on the "red list".

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: People 45 or over in England are being offered a Covid vaccine.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk on transport?
item.description: As UK coronavirus restrictions continue to be relaxed, public transport could become much busier.

item.title: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Pub gardens and non-essential shops can now open in England - as part of the next stage of easing lockdown rules.

item.title: Covid: When will children return to school and what are the rules?
item.description: Children are returning to school across the UK, after months of enforced home-schooling.

item.title: Why are so many babies dying of Covid-19 in Brazil?
item.description: As the pandemic rages in Brazil, hundreds of babies and young children are dying of Covid.

item.title: Prince Philip: A turbulent childhood stalked by exile, mental illness and death
item.description: In marrying, Philip was able to regain the "simple pleasures" of family life he had lost aged eight.

item.title: Race report: Was controversy part of the plan?
item.description: How the government handled the release of a contentious report on racial disparity in the UK.

item.title: 'We found a baby on the subway - now he's our son'
item.description: Danny Stewart saw something on the floor of an NY subway station - soon he would treasure it more than anything.
